meanings.definition: To force someone to walk forward by holding their arms tightly behind their back.
meanings.sent1: The police were frogmarching the criminal to the patrol car.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were frogmarching the new recruits during training.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly threatened to frogmarch the mischievous student to the principal's office.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind seemed to frogmarch the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The image of the villain frogmarching the hero towards danger stayed in the audience's mind.

meanings.definition: To march someone forward in a rough or forceful manner.
meanings.sent1: The protestors were frogmarching towards the government building, chanting slogans.
meanings.sent2: The coach was frogmarching the team to victory with strict training sessions.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully frogmarched each other around the backyard during their game.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to frogmarch the clouds across the sky, darkening the day.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her father frogmarching her down the aisle on her wedding day brought tears to her eyes.
